Education Student finance

Get help if you're at school, planning to go on to further or higher education, looking for training or interested in a student or career development loan.

Aug 2011—Sept 2012 previous versions

  1. Aug 2010—Sept 2011 view this version
  2. Aug 2009—Sept 2010 view this version

How it works

  • Register or log in to student finance

    You can log in to your student finance account or sign up. Once registered, you can apply for student finance, see when your payments are due, track your application and change your details.

  • Student finance evidence needed by students

    You need to give proof of identity the first time you apply for student finance. Generally, you don't need to send anything else unless you're asked to or your circumstances change.

  • Student finance: evidence needed by parents and partners

    If you're the parent or partner of a student applying for finance you may need to give evidence of your income or circumstances.

  • Extra money to pay for university

    Students in higher education can apply for money directly from their university or college on top of any other student finance - you don't have to pay this money back.

  • Student jobs - paying tax

    If you have a job when you're a student you may need to pay Income Tax and National Insurance (NI).

  • Funding for postgraduate study

    You can get funding for postgraduate study through studentships, bursaries, grants and loans - you might also be able to get help from your employer.

  • Paying back your student loan

    The only student finance you have to pay back are Tuition Fee Loans and Maintenance Loans.
